title: How to load JSON file data
content:
• make json file (you can see it on 'models' directory for content or menu file.)
  • define json file example: #routes/index/js - 'menus' value.
  • send the value on routes
  • use it on your view example: #views/index/index.hbs or #views/index/json.hbs
title_implementation: data on dashboard page using json file from #models/menu.json

title: How to load spesific JSON file data
content:
• open example code on #routes/index.js/routes for 'json_detail'

title_implementation: data on this page get from #models/content.json

title: How to using POST
content:
• open example code on #routes/form.js/routes for '/'
  • there's two routes for '/', it use 'get' and 'post'
  • see the different on how the routes define data and the view show the data from the POST submit data
title_implementation: check on #routes/form.js to see the code

title: Form with CSRF
content:
• install 'csurf' and 'express-session' from your NPM
  • on #app.js, add variable session and app.use(session...
  • on #routes/form.js define csrf configuration for the routes
  • see on routes 'form/csrf' to see how it works.

title: How to connect mongodb using mongoose
content:
• Download mongodb
  • extract your download file and aim your terminal cursor to the mongodb extract file directory 'cd your_mongo_file/bin'
  • insert this command to your terminal './mongod'
  • for mac, you need to insert some commands to create 'data/db' directory => 'mkdir -p /data/db', 'sudo chmod 0755 /data/db', and 'sudo chown $USER /data/db'
title_implementation: check on #routes/form.js to see the code

title: Manage data (show list, edit, delete) with mongodb
content:
• This page will show you how to load data, edit and delete data
  • load data: all routes from #routes/mongo.js file. Call customer data with 'find' instructions.
  • edit data: it will get from routes 'edit/:id', id is parameter for data that you want to update. You can get id value from 'list or index' page, and get it in each data on the list
  • delete data: will run on routes 'delete/:id', params same with implementation on 'edit' routes
